title: Junction support
body:
I have several JUNCTIONS inside of my windows home folder. When accessing my home folder via Bash, I get:
ls: cannot access MY_JUNCTION_FOLDER_1: input/output error
ls: cannot access MY_JUNCTION_FOLDER_2: input/output error

comments.body: +1 this is blocking dev with npm. MAJOR issue
Is there any news on this and syncronising links and junctions in general? I really want to use wsl with npm and VS Code but this is a blocking issue

This is pretty much a dealbreaking blocker for NPM/node developers: if your sources/development environment are in Windows and you have pm2/forever/nginx in WSL, nginx/node is unable to follow the junction, resulting in Error: Cannot find module your linked module'
Also if I create a symbols link on WSL with both link and target under /mnt/c I really want to have a working JUNCTION in windows.
I have a different volume mounted to C:\TEMP via diskmgmt.msc.  Needless to say, Bash can't access it.

As interoperability is a valued goal - and reason why someone would even want to use WSL (rather than just boot to Linux), the ability to cross-access file system features is of significant importance.  Particularly since NTFS supports symlinks that are nearly 100% compatible with Posix symlinks.
If you create a (symbolic) link from within the bash itself, it works. The link has to be symbolic, directory junction from bash on /mnt/* folders still doesn't work.
